hero.subtitle: We're on a mission to digitize and connect the global agricultural supply chain, empowering every stakeholder from the soil to the shelf.

vision.title: Our Vision for a Connected Future
vision.p1: DamDoh was born from a simple yet powerful idea: that technology can bridge the gaps in the agricultural world. We envision a world where smallholder farmers have direct access to global markets, where buyers can source produce with verifiable confidence, and where knowledge flows freely to create a more sustainable and equitable food system.
vision.p2: We are more than a platform; we are a community dedicated to solving real-world challenges with innovative, user-centric solutions.

challenge.title: The Fragmented Landscape of Agriculture
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is a complex and often disconnected ecosystem, presenting numerous challenges for everyone involved.
details: Smallholders struggle to connect with larger, more profitable markets.
Poor coordination leads to high costs and significant post-harvest losses.
Lack of formal records prevents access to credit, loans, and insurance.
Farmers lack access to modern techniques and real-time market data.
Buyers face uncertainty about produce quality, origin, and farming practices.
Increasing unpredictability requires more resilient farming systems.
A significant portion of food is lost between the farm and the consumer.
Siloed information prevents a holistic view of the supply chain.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution: An Integrated Ecosystem
solution.description: We address these challenges by providing a single, unified platform with tools for everyone.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: Farmers connecting with other farmers to share knowledge and form cooperatives.

p2b.title: Producer-to-Business
p2b.content: Direct links between farmers and buyers, processors, and exporters, cutting out unnecessary middlemen.

p2e.title: Producer-to-Expert
p2e.content: Access to agronomists, financial advisors, and logistics providers to improve operations.

p2w.title: Producer-to-World
p2w.content: Allowing smallholder farmers to participate in the global market with confidence and transparency.

commitment.title: Join Our Growing Ecosystem
commitment.p1: Our commitment is to the people who feed the world. We believe that by providing the digital tools they need, we can foster a more resilient, profitable, and sustainable agricultural sector for generations to come.
commitment.p2: Whether you're planting a seed, buying in bulk, or financing a farm, you have a place in the DamDoh community.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: Welcome to DamDoh. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy will inform you as to how we look after your personal data when you visit our website (regardless of where you visit it from) and tell you about your privacy rights and how the law protects you.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: 1. What Information We Collect
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We may collect, use, store and transfer different kinds of personal data about you which we have grouped together as follows: Identity Data, Contact Data, Financial Data, Transaction Data, Technical Data, Profile Data, Usage Data, and Marketing and Communications Data.

howWeUseInfo.heading: 2. How We Use Your Information
howWeUseInfo.content: We will only use your personal data when the law allows us to. Most commonly, we will use your personal data to perform the contract we are about to enter into or have entered into with you, to comply with a legal obligation, and where it is necessary for our legitimate interests.

willInfoBeShared.heading: 3. Will Your Information Be Shared With Anyone?
willInfoBeShared.content: We may have to share your personal data with external third parties such as service providers, professional advisers, regulators and other authorities. We require all third parties to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: 4. Do We Use Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies (like web beacons and pixels) to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Policy.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: 5. How Long Do We Keep Your Information?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes we collected it for, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: 6. How Do We Keep Your Information Safe?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We have put in place appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used or accessed in an unauthorized way, altered or disclosed. In addition, we limit access to your personal data to those employees, agents, contractors and other third parties who have a business need to know.

minors.heading: 7. Do We Collect Information From Minors?
minors.content: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age. By using the Services, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent’s use of the Services.

privacyRights.heading: 8. What Are Your Privacy Rights?
privacyRights.content: In some regions, such as the European Economic Area (EEA) and UK, you have rights that allow you greater access to and control over your personal data. You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: 9. Controls for Do-Not-Track Features
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. We do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.

updatesToNotice.heading: 10. Do We Make Updates to This Notice?
updatesToNotice.content: Yes, we will update this notice as necessary to stay compliant with relevant laws. The updated version will be indicated by an updated 'Revised' date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Our commitment to a safe, respectful, and professional community.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! We are building a professional network based on trust and mutual respect. To ensure a positive experience for everyone, we ask all members to adhere to the following guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Engage in courteous and constructive discussions. Personal attacks, harassment, hate speech, and any form of bullying will not be tolerated. Treat everyone with the professionalism you expect.

authentic.title: Be Authentic and Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business truthfully. Do not misrepresent your products, services, certifications, or experience. Transparency is key to building trust in our network.

relevant.title: Stay On-Topic and Add Value
relevant.description: Contribute relevant, high-quality content in forums and discussions. Avoid spam, unsolicited promotions, or off-topic comments. Share your knowledge and help others learn.

fairTrade.title: Uphold Fair Trade Practices
fairTrade.description: Conduct all business on the Marketplace with integrity. Fulfill your orders, pay agreed-upon prices, and communicate clearly with your transaction partners. Do not engage in fraudulent or deceptive practices.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: We are a platform dedicated to improving the agricultural ecosystem. We encourage discussions and practices that promote environmental stewardship, economic viability, and social equity.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team. You can flag content directly within the platform or contact us via email at {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to these guidelines. Violations may result in content removal, account suspension, or permanent removal from the platform. Thank you for helping us build a trusted and valuable community.
